DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and effectiveness of as needed versus fixed dosing of an investigational medication for women with severe diarrhea-predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who have failed conventional therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Study In Women With Severe Diarrhea-Predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome Having Failed Conventional Therapy
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with severe diarrheapredominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). Failed conventional therapy. Willing to make daily calls on a touchtone telephone. Exclusion criteria: History of or current chronic or severe constipation. Bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain with rectal bleeding. Thrombophlebitis. Abnormal thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) value. Alcohol and/or substance abuse within past two years. Pregnant or lactating. History/treatment of malignancy within past five years.
